name: gblocks
title: Gblocks
description: <text lang="en">Selection of conserved blocks from multiple sequence alignment</text> </description>

infile.comment: <text lang="en">FASTA-formatted alignments are accepted by gblocks. There is no limit for the number of sequences or positions in the alignment as long as there is enough memory available for the program.</text> </comment>

input_type.comment: <text lang="en"> Automatic: For FASTA-formatted alignments, gblocks assigned the type Protein automatically.</text> <text lang="en"> In other cases, precise.</text> </comment>

MNOSFACP.prompt: Minimum Number Of Sequences For A Conserved Position(-b1)
MNOSFACP.comment: <text lang="en">Any integer BIGGER than half the number of sequences and SMALLER OR EQUAL than the total number of sequences. If you put an integer not in this interval, gblocks will run the program with default value, check the warning in output. </text> <text lang="en">By default, = 50% of the number of sequences +1.</text> </comment>

MNOSFOFP.prompt: Minimum Number Of Sequences For A Flank Position(-b2)
MNOSFOFP.comment: <text lang="en">Any integer EQUAL OR SMALLER than Minimum Number Of Sequences For A Conserved Position. If you put an integer not in this interval, gblocks will run the program with default value, check the warning in output. </text> <text lang="en">By default, = 85% of the number of sequences.</text> </comment>

MLOAB.comment: <text lang="en">Any integer equal or bigger than 2 (= 10 by default).</text> </comment>

gap.comment: <text lang="en"> None(default value): No gap positions are allowed in the final alignment.</text> <text lang="en"> With Half: Positions with a gap in less than 50% of the sequences selected in the final alignment (if they're in an appropriate block).</text> <text lang="en"> All: Positions with gaps are not treated differently from others positions.</text> </comment>

MNOCNP.prompt: Maximum Number Of Contiguous Nonconserved Positions(-b3)
MNOCNP.comment: <text lang="en">All segment with contiguous non-conserved positions bigger than this value is rejected (=8 by default).</text> </comment>

sb.comment: <text lang="en">Saving or Not the alignment file with the selected blocks.</text> </comment>

Res_Param.comment: <text lang="en">Saving an HTML file (Yes), saving a text file (Text), saving a short text file (Short Text) or not saving any of them (No). </text> <text lang="en">With the first two options the original file is shown with the selected blocks underlined and, in the HTML file, with colored conserved positions.</text> <text lang="en">The parameters used and the flank positions of the selected blocks are written in these files.</text> </comment>

PerLine.comment: <text lang="en">Number of characters per line in the alignment shown in the Results And Parameters File.</text> <text lang="en">Any integer bigger than 50 is accepted (60 by default).</text> </comment>

nc.comment: <text lang="en">Saving or Not a the alignment file with the blocks NOT selected (i.e., the complementary of the selected blocks).</text> </comment>

ua.comment: <text lang="en">Saving or Not the alignment file where only gap positions (i.e. positions with at least one gap) have been removed.</text> </comment>

mask.prompt: Mask File With The Selected Blocks (-k)
mask.comment: <text lang="en">Saving or Not a file that can be read by the program SeqPup.</text> <text lang="en">In this file, conserved positions as defined by Gblocks are shadowed and selected blocks underlined</text> </comment>

ps.prompt: Postscript File With The Selected Blocks (-d)
ps.comment: <text lang="en">Saving or Not a Postscript file that shows schematically the selected blocks. You need a postscript viewer or editor to view this file.</text> </comment>

mask_file.prompt: Mask File With The Selected Blocks

comment: <text lang="en">forest2consense processes two files containing lists of trees, and, for each of the possible combinations between the a tree of file 1 and a tree of file 2, a consensus tree using PHYLIP's consense package. tree leaves IDs renaming is processed using nw_rename</text> </comment>
